column4: you might take a screen shot of gparted a pastebin it just so your helpers know the partitioning setup as of now
there is an image bin as well .
ah, ok...so whats the keys for a screenshot?
use the screenshot in the menu and image bin  http://imagebin.org/index.php?page=add
thanks hod on

the partition you would resize is half full, the paging and unmovable files are going to be pretty far onto that partition. Just a resize of it=sda3 has some danger without setting it up coeewctly for resizing. Are you completely backed up?
no, but there isn't anything on there I can't afford to lose..assuming I don't lose the operating system.
I have defragged it today though.
if it was me I would turn off the paging reboot it then defragg it then shrink it with gparted leaving a open space for a extended partition to put linux in
turn of paging? how do I do that?

you turn it off do the rebot to remove it and defragg again, follow this on how to turn t off. When your finished installing Linux you can turn t back on. http://www.mydigitallife.info/tweak-windows-vista-virtual-memory-change-or-disable-paging-file-size/
peronally i have my paging file off altogether I just clone my setups regularly and, and stor everything externally.
alright, headed to go turn paging off, defrag and then come back for further instructions.
You still around?
paging off and defragged. Now I've deleted the DellUtility and RECOVER partion and resizing the OS partition to about 125 GiB
sounds like your on the right track Vista still boots correct?
just started the resize about 5 minutes ago...I have no idea and afraid to test it.
if it doesn't boot it is an easy fix. Sometimes that recovery has oart of the boot.
you have a vista disc correct.
sounds good...if it doesn't boot i'm not going to fight it to hard...i'll just wipe it for more ubuntu space
negative
W7 is not bad I never use it but would if  have to. It is installed for understanding, and for the few times I need ms word for college papers.
no way i'll just outright buy W7, Vista, or any other OS like that without it being pre-installed on a shiny new computer.
about how long does it take 222.78GiB to resize down to 123.63 GiB?
